solution_line_template: In the first year, Bobby will acquire {initial_cars} * {percent_increase} = <<{initial_cars}*{percent_increase}={first_year_new_cars}>>{first_year_new_cars} new cars.
After the first year, he will have a total of {initial_cars} + {first_year_new_cars} = <<{initial_cars}+{first_year_new_cars}={after_first_year}>>{after_first_year} cars.
In the second year, Bobby will acquire {after_first_year} * {percent_increase} = <<{after_first_year}*{percent_increase}={second_year_new_cars}>>{second_year_new_cars} new cars.
After the second year, he will have {after_first_year} + {second_year_new_cars} = <<{after_first_year}+{second_year_new_cars}={after_second_year}>>{after_second_year} cars in total.
In the third year, Bobby will acquire {after_second_year} * {percent_increase} = <<{after_second_year}*{percent_increase}={third_year_new_cars}>>{third_year_new_cars} new cars.
After the third year, he will have {after_second_year} + {third_year_new_cars} = <<{after_second_year}+{third_year_new_cars}={after_third_year}>>{after_third_year} cars in total.
